nameEntry.part: Moss Visit and Report [British child migration]

biogHist.abstract: In December 1951, a British Home Office official named John Moss visited Western Australian institutions where British child migrants were living. Moss had been a member of the 1944 UK Care of Children Committee (the Curtis Committee). His report, known as the Moss Report, was submitted to the British government in 1953 and was 'relatively positive' about child migration institutions and practices in Australia.

John Moss Report on Child Migration - Implementation of Recommendations, National Archives of Australia (1953 - 1955)

descriptiveNote.p: In 1953, John Moss CBE, a former member of the Curtis Committee, submitted a report on Australian child migration institutions and processes to the Home Office authorities in the UK.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Enquiry by Mr. John Moss. Points on which information is needed as to provision for the welfare of children emigrating from the United Kingdom to Australia

archref.unittitle: Enquiry by Mr. John Moss. Points on which information is needed as to provision for the welfare of children emigrating from the United Kingdom to Australia
archref.abstract: 'Enquiry by Mr. John Moss. Points on which information is needed as to provision for the welfare of children emigrating from the United Kingdom to Australia' is an excerpt from the digital copy of the Moss John - visiting Child Welfare Expert file from the National Archives of Australia website. It is the questionnaire that was circulated to government, the organisations that received and placed child migrants, and the children's Homes where the children lived. This questionnaire was received by the Commonwealth Government on 10 May 1951.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Moss Report [Exerpt] - Inspection Itinerary and Curriculum Vitae

archref.unittitle: Moss Report [Exerpt] - Inspection Itinerary and Curriculum Vitae
archref.abstract: This is an excerpt from the digital copy of the John Moss Report on Child Migration - Implementation of Recommendations from the National Archives of Australia website. This excerpt shows the timetable of meetings, visits and inspections by Mr John Moss CBE and the curriculum vitae (CV) of this 'child welfare expert' from Britain.
